cause.description:
The Alpha Omega Epsilon National Foundation was founded December 5, 1996 by five members of Alpha Omega Epsilon International Sorority who wanted to further encourage other women in engineering and technical sciences.
The Foundation was granted tax exempt status under the 501(c)(3) IRS code in March of 1998, retroactive to date of founding. The 501(c)(3) status allows the Foundation to accept tax-deductable donations within the United States.
The AOE National Foundation sponsors an annual scholarship program and awards bi-yearly grants for activities that enhance opportunities for women in engineering and technical sciences.
1. Women studying in the engineering and technical sciences field need more support.
cause.mission: Provide educational opportunities to women in engineering and technical sciences that enhance personal, professional, and academic development.
cause.name: Alpha Omega Epsilon National Foundation
